INIZ – KVM in Los Angeles and OpenVZ in NY, LA and Amsterdam

amsterdam, Iniz.com, kvm, los angeles, netherlands, New York City, openvz, USA April 23, 2015 @ 1:00 pm, by Jonathan Tan

Patrick, from INIZ, is back with great offers to celebrate their launch of KVM service in Los Angeles, CA, USA. They also included several OpenVZ offers in New York, Los Angeles and Amsterdam. Most of the plans listed includes DDOS protection. These are indeed very exciting and great value offers for our LowEndBox readers!

IPv6 are not included by default but you can request single addresses or /64 via ticket.

LA-KVM-256MB

  • 2 CPU cores
  • 256MB RAM
  • 30GB SSD Cached space
  • 500GB bandwidth
  • 1x IPv4 address
  • 20Gbps/20Mpps DDoS Protection
  • KVM/SolusVM
  • Los Angeles
  • $24.15/year
  • Order here
LA-KVM-512MB

  • 3 CPU cores
  • 512MB RAM
  • 40GB SSD Cached space
  • 2TB bandwidth
  • 2x IPv4 address
  • 20Gbps/20Mpps DDoS Protection
  • KVM/SolusVM
  • Los Angeles
  • $6.90/month
  • Order here

INIZ is an active and popular provider in the LowEndBox and LowEndTalk community. They have been featured many times before, and reviews from users are very positive throughout the life of the company. They have also achieved 3rd place in the Top Provider quarterly poll three times in a row. That’s a great testament to their quality of service! Zeniva Limited took over INIZ llast October 14, and since then they improved their infrastructure across all 3 locations. If you are a current customer with INIZ, please do share your reviews and comments below.

All nodes are powered by Intel CPU’s (L5640/X5650/X5670/E5-2620/E5-2650) with minimum of 128GB RAM and hardware RAID10 disk configuration. All nodes are connected to 2x 1Gbps bonded uplinks. They recently acquired RIPE IP space which goes along with their currently owned ARIN space. rDNS for IPV4 & IPv6 can be managed from the control panel automatically.

More offers inside!

OVZ-AMSLAPROT-1024MB

  • 4 CPU cores
  • 1024MB RAM
  • 512MB vSwap
  • 75GB HDD
  • 1TB bandwidth
  • 1x IPv4 address
  • 20Gbps/20Mpps DDoS Protection
  • OpenVZ/SolusVM
  • Amsterdam, NL or Los Angeles, CA
  • $6.90/month
  • Order here
OVZ-256MB

  • 2 CPU cores
  • 256MB RAM
  • 128MB vSwap
  • 50GB HDD (submit ticket after ordering to get 100GB)
  • 500GB bandwidth
  • 1x IPv4 address
  • OpenVZ/SolusVM
  • Amsterdam / New York / Los Angeles
  • Los Angeles includes 20Gbps/20Mpps Protection
  • $21.94/year
  • Order here
OpenVZ-IO4G

  • 3 CPU cores
  • 4096MB RAM
  • 75GB HDD
  • 1TB bandwidth
  • 1x IPv4 address
  • OpenVZ/SolusVM
  • Amsterdam / New York / Los Angeles
  • Los Angeles includes 20Gbps/20Mpps Protection
  • $6.58/month
  • Order here

Patrick told us that INIZ does not utilise any tunnels. All protection (layer 3,4,7) are done by their upstream and so there is no latency change when under attack. For Los Angeles, protection is on sensor mode. Once an attack is detected within a minute the attack goes through filtering automatically. For Amsterdam, there is a little more control on their end. The protected plan comes with permanent filtering and so all traffic will go through the mitigation devices first.

INIZ accepts payments via Paypal, Credit/Debit Cards & Bitcoins. Refunds are only possible within the first 7 days of your first order only (except the IO4G plan), subsequent orders are not eligible for refunds. Some activities not allowed on their servers includes: IRC networks, Mass Mailing, Public torrents/VPN/Proxies, Minecraft and other IO intensive applications, TOR, Phishing, and Brute Force/Scanning. As always, kindly read their Terms Of Service before making any purchase.

Network Looking Glass & Test Files:

Atlantic Metro, New York, NY (USA): http://nyc-us.lg.iniz.com

Quadranet, Los Angeles, CA (USA): http://la-us.lg.iniz.com

NForce, Amsterdam, NL (EU): http://ams-nl.lg.iniz.com
